constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 21 (Thursday, February 4, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. FORTENBERRY:
H.R. 810.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
The constitutional authority for this bill is pursuant to
Article I, Section 8, Clause 18 of the United States
Constitution.
[Page H387]

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

title: To amend the National Trails System Act to direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study on the feasibility of designating the Chief Standing Bear National Historic Trail, and for other purposes.
